This instance we present a short lecture on the theory behind PCA and what we can learn from them, and then show some commonly used R tools used to perform PCA on different kinds of data with an emphasis on data from a RNA sequencing project.
 
**Topic:** PCA - Theory and Practice \
**When:** Monday, 02nd of December, 09:45 \
**Where:** Campus Alnarp, Triticum
and via **[Zoom](https://slu-se.zoom.us/j/69486568642)**(Password: 410 410)

**Preparation:**
You are welcome to sit in and listen. However, if you would like to follow the practical part, please bring your computer with Rstudio installed.

The material will be available on [Github](https://github.com/SLUBioinformaticsInfrastructure/Three_Bees_Workshop_Series) after the session.
